Text: Lake surfing:  Lake surfers are often out during and experiencing the same storm that creates the waves whereas ocean surfers are more often surfing on swell produced by storms hundreds of miles away and that may have taken days to reach shore.

Text: Lake surfing:  In addition to making it more difficult to manage surfboards, high winds can make the face of a wave and water surface rough.

Text: Lake surfing:  This can make it necessary to paddle out through waves because there may not be a long enough pause between sets to paddle out between them.
